citation.article-title: Pseudomonas plantarii sp. nov., the causal agent of rice seedling blight.

p.s: Description of Pseudomonas plantarii sp. nov.
Pseudomonas plantarii (plan'tar. i. i. L. n. plantarium, seedbed; L. gen. n. plantarii, of seedbed)
Cells are gram negative, nonsporeforming, nonencapsulated straight rods (0.7 to 1.O by 1.4 to 1.9 μm), motile with one to three polar flagella, and occur singly, in pairs, or in short chains.
Aerobic.
Colonies are translucent, glistening, convex, and round with entire edges and a smooth surface having a slight yellow tint.
Colonies weakly produce a water-soluble reddish brown pigment depending on conditions of the culture and media.
Oxidase and catalase positive.
Does not require an organic growth factor.
Accumulates poly-β-hydroxybutyrate.
Does not produce fluorescent pigments.
Does not produce levan from sucrose.
Gelatin liquefaction positive.
Lecithinase positive.
Hydrolyzes Tween 80, cotton seed oil, and casein.
Does not hydrolyze starch, esculin, or arbutin.
Reduces nitrate to nitrite.
Denitrification positive.
Arginine dihydrolase and phenylalanine deaminase negative.
Minimum, optimum, and maximum temperatures are 4 to 10, 32 to 35, and 38°C, respectively.
Milk peptonization positive, but coagulation negative.
BCP milk reaction alkaline.
Voges-Proskauer and methyl red negative.
Gluconate oxidation negative.
Does not rot potato tuber slices.
Tobacco hypersensitivity reaction negative.
Can grow in Cohn's, Fermi's, and Uschinsky's solutions.
Tolerates 3% but not 5% NaCl.
Produces ammonia.
Does not produce indole or hydrogen sulfide.

Acid and no gas produced from D-glucose, D-galactose, D-fructose, D-xylose, mannitol, sorbitol, D-arabinose, L-arabinose, D-mannose, meso-inositol, L-rhamnose, D-ribose, cellobiose, melibiose, salicin, galactitol, n-propanol, and glycerol.
Acid and gas are not produced from maltose, lactose, sucrose, trehalose, melezitose, raffinose, inulin, starch, dextrin, erythritol, adonitol, geraniol, and 2,3-butylene glycol.

The bacterium can utilize saccharate, malonate, citrate, DL-β-hydroxybutyrate, L-arginine, D-tartrate, L-tartrate, meso-tartrate, lactate, p-hydroxybenzoate, glycolate, citraconate, nicotinate, mesaconate, betaine, and L-valine.
Cannot utilize tryptamine, α-amylamine, β-alanine, benzoate, m-hydroxybenzoate, trigonelline, and levulinate.
The G+C content of the DNA is 64.8 mol%.
The type strain is NIAES 1723T (JCM 5492).
